com.putable.tilenet.client
Class VKMap

java.lang.Object
  com.putable.tilenet.client.VKMap

public final class VKMap
extends java.lang.Object

A little all-static 'let's reflect on it' class to extract the VK_ 'virtual key' constants from java.awt.event.KeyEvent and provide them in a String<->Integer mappable form. May be used by students enrolled in UNM CS 351 Fall 2013, as long as they are so enrolled.

Version:
1.3
Author:
ackley
See Also:
KeyEvent

Method Detail

getKeyCode

public static java.lang.Integer getKeyCode(java.lang.String keyName)
Map from the name of 'virtual keycode' -- such as "VK_A" or "VK_HOME" -- to the corresponding Integer value as declared in the class KeyEvent. For example, if keyName is "VK_X", this method returns 88, the value of KeyEvent.VK_X. If the supplied keyName does not match a VK_* constant from KeyEvent, returns null.

Parameters:
keyName - The name of the key constant to look up (including the "VK_" part -- so "VK_ENTER" is right but "ENTER" is wrong).
Returns:
the value of the corresponding constant if it exists, or null if no such public static constant of that name is declared in class KeyEvent

getKeyName

public static java.lang.String getKeyName(java.lang.Integer keyCode)
Map from an Integer value representing a 'virtual keycode' to the corresponding String name of the keycode as defined by KeyEvent, if one exists. For example, if keyCode is 88, this method returns "VK_X", corresponding to KeyEvent.VK_X. If the supplied keyCode is null or there is no matching 'VK_' constant, returns null

Parameters:
keyCode - value to map
Returns:
A String beginning with "VK_" if that name is defined in KeyEvent to have value keyCode, or null

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
A little test driver. Supply VK_ keynames to look up on the command line, or supply no arguments to get a representative smattering of defined and undefined names tested.

Parameters:
args - Strings to look up as VK_ keynames.
